Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[release/8.0] Fix Clear and Remove after Sort in TreeView" (#10398)

Issues.Title: When operating on part of a sorted TreeView tree: Clear() hangs in a loop; Remove() removes wrong nodes.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0.

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Works as expected in .NET 7.0.

### Issue description

Starting with a clean empty TreeView:

1. Add a top level node.
2. Under the top level node, add two nodes with their Text in reverse alphabetial order.
3. Sort the TreeView to change the order of the two sub-nodes.
4. Clear the sub-nodes.

The Clear() operation hangs, and never completes.

If, instead of clearing the nodes, you try:

4. Remove the first sub node
5. Remove the second sub node.

The first Remove() removes the wrong node; the second throws an index out of range exception.

### Steps to reproduce


	var devices = new TreeNode("Devices");
	TreeView1.Nodes.Add(devices);

	var switches = new TreeNode("Switches");
	devices.Nodes.Add(switches);
	var leds = new TreeNode("LEDs");
	devices.Nodes.Add(leds);

	TreeView1.Sort();

	// Test 1
	devices.Nodes.Clear();			// Hangs
	MessageBox.Show("Cleared");		// Never reached

	// Test 2
	devices.Nodes.Remove(switches);		// Removes LEDs
	devices.Nodes.Remove(leds);		// Throws exception
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "When operating on part of a sorted TreeView tree: Clear() hangs in a loop; Remove() removes wrong nodes." (#10376)

Issues.Title: Fix Clear and Remove after Sort in TreeView
Issues.Body:
Fixes #10376

## Proposed changes

- Fix Clear and Remove after Sort in TreeView. It looks like we broke this in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9078 by following https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9078#discussion_r1187710943. Perhaps we should just bring back the old method instead of using the current approach?

Issues.Title: Add additional test coverage for `TreeView`
Issues.Body:
#10376 showed we have some weaknesses in automated tests coverage of `TreeView` after sorting. We should add more tests that validate indices and other `TreeView` behavior after sorting nodes, covering things such as:

- Multiple levels of nodes
- Equivalent node values (do equivalent values go to the expected indices? check node reference equality)

Issues.Title: Custom .NET Standard 2.0 components aren't displayed in Toolbox in VisualStudio v17.8
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Microsoft Visual Studio version 17.8.0

### .NET version

.NET 6.0 - WinForms

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

Yes, it works in Visual Studio v17.6.5.
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/45847465/a49bf62f-8b1e-4ebd-b3de-02d87c5a62e9)

### Issue description

Hi, I'm from DevExpress.
Our users encountered an issue where some of our components are not displayed in WinForms .NET OOP DesignTime. In our .NET Standard 2.0 libraries, we have custom inheritors of the Component class. This issue started in Visual Studio v17.8 (or earlier). After a little research, it appears to be related to the following tab: [https://github.com/microsoft/winforms-designer/pull/5231/](https://github.com/microsoft/winforms-designer/pull/5231/). To demonstrate the issue, we created a small example.

### Steps to reproduce

To reproduce it, follow these steps.
1. Download and unzip [NetStandardProblem.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/13498299/NetStandardProblem.zip).
2. Open the designer Form1.cs.
3. Make sure that MyComponent from ClassLibrary1 is not displayed in the toolbox.
![image2](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/45847465/41e882eb-5833-412a-88a7-6331b7104e14)

### Diagnostics

_No response_

Issues.Title: DPI rendering issue since .NET 8
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Worked in .NET 7 and .NET 6

### Issue description

I'm aware that this is a "special" issue which may only affect me in this particular use case but I hope I can find a solution or workaround.

I have an Open Source project utilizing FreeRDP to do remote desktops in a WinForms control:
https://github.com/royalapplications/royalapps-community-freerdp

It basically starts wfreerdp.exe with a couple of CLI args to pass on a window handle, a desktop width and a desktop height.
The wfreerdp.exe then "paints" into that window handle and processes input (mouse and keyboard). This worked fine until I updated to .NET 8. I guess the DPI changes in .NET 8 broke this and I'm not sure if and how I can restore the "previous" behavior.

I tested 3 High DPI Modes with display scaling > 100%:
* DpiUnaware: scaling works fine in .NET 7 and .NET 8
* SystemAware: scaling works fine in .NET 7 but does not work in .NET 8
* PerMonitorV2: scaling works fine in .NET 7 but does not work in .NET 8

The control I use to wrap FreeRDP does some scaling calculations based on the DPI to properly "zoom" the remote session. Even if I skip these calculations and simply pass on the dimensions, scaling seems to be off.

### Steps to reproduce

1)
Clone Repo:
https://github.com/royalapplications/royalapps-community-freerdp

2)
Set display settings on the local machine to > 100%

3)
Start the Demo with .NET 7 and use Connection -> Connect to connect to a Windows machine (host and creds are prompted if not specified in code or config window)
Scaling works as expected.

4)
Start the Demo with .NET 8 and do the same as in 3)
Scaling is off
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "DPI rendering issue since .NET 8" (#10373)

Issues.Title: [LOC] Shortcuts localization in .net 8 must use CurrentUICulture
Issues.Body:
### Which files are affected?

With the following configuration:

- Microsoft Windows 11 (NT 10.0.22621.0)

![image](https://github.com/gitextensions/gitextensions/assets/460196/b5ad9eec-f04b-445f-aeea-afbb8544e737)

![image](https://github.com/gitextensions/gitextensions/assets/460196/bd704d50-7a24-4f2b-ba9f-ea0eb9b6ee2b)

The application [GitExtensions](https://github.com/gitextensions/gitextensions) with a keyboard shortcut defined in `.Designer.cs` file like that:

```csharp
            // 
            // fileExplorerToolStripMenuItem
            // 
            fileExplorerToolStripMenuItem.Image = Properties.Images.BrowseFileExplorer;
            fileExplorerToolStripMenuItem.Name = "fileExplorerToolStripMenuItem";
            fileExplorerToolStripMenuItem.ShortcutKeys = ((Keys)(((Keys.Control | Keys.Shift) 
            | Keys.O)));
```

when launched using .net6 ( .NET 6.0.25 ) displays shortcuts like that (in english):

![image](https://github.com/gitextensions/gitextensions/assets/460196/80ef85ab-5dc0-47bf-970b-f92ef17cd6b6)

whereas in .net8 (.NET 8.0.0 ), the shortcut is displayed in french (even if the OS is in english due to the settings defined above):

![image](https://github.com/gitextensions/gitextensions/assets/460196/1ddd7fff-41dd-4c25-96bc-04b49b27457e)

I think that keyboard shortcuts should use `CurrentUICulture` to localize instead of using the `CurrentCulture`.

It is strange to have the OS and the application in English (by choice) and just the keyboard shortcuts in French...




### Which languages are affected?

French
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[LOC] Shortcuts localization in .net 8 must use CurrentUICulture" (#10384)

Issues.Title: Screen Resolutions issue - UI issue of responsiveness with screen resolution (125%, 150%)
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 7

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

UI breaking, It's working fine with 100 % resolution, but not with 125%, and 150
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/137883104/c39685f5-282a-4d20-9ddd-2b5fa17cb49a)
% resolution. 

### Steps to reproduce

These are UI issues:
First, we open application in 100% resolution and it's working fine, once we go and change resolution 100 to 125% UI distorted. Could you please let me know how we will support responsive UI in any size of resolution in windows forms.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Screen Resolutions issue - UI issue of responsiveness with screen resolution (125%, 150%)" (#10382)
